page.title: 04Nether Stowey:Old Features 2
page.content: Tom Poole was a benefactor of the village and a tanner . His tannery was situated behind the old village school in what is now called The Tanyard. It has been converted into a private house called 'Mill House'. Tom Poole paid for the building of the old village school which he gave to the village in 1812. It is built from local red sandstone and now houses a fine library and museum. Poole's Close is named after him. An old building in Lime Street has been a smithy for over 100 years. This is still a working blacksmith's. Opposite is a large archway where the wheelwright's shop once stood and just up the road is the saddlery, now selling leather goods and repairing saddles.
